lessonOutcomes.outcome: Students can write sentences (e.g., “She’s got long fingers too.”) clearly and accurately in the correct space.
supportStrategies: (Writing) Write: “She’s got long fingers too.” Say each word clearly. Students copy sentence onto lines, checking word order.
stretchStrategies: ❝Partner Body Draw & Swap❞ – Students draw their partner and write 2–3 descriptive sentences under it (e.g., “She’s got long legs. She’s got short arms.”). Then they swap and check if the description matches.

lessonOutcomes.outcome: Students can listen to spoken descriptions and select the correct person or body part.
supportStrategies: (Listening) Say: “She’s got short hair.” “He’s got a long nose.” Students point to the matching person in the SB or on the board.
stretchStrategies: ❝Partner Body Draw & Swap❞ – Students draw their partner and write 2–3 descriptive sentences under it (e.g., “She’s got long legs. She’s got short arms.”). Then they swap and check if the description matches.

lessonOutcomes.outcome: Students can work together politely and take turns in a collaborative creative activity and presentation.
supportStrategies: (4Cs – Creative Teamwork) Groups draw a new character with body part features. They present it using “He’s got...” or “She’s got...” sentences.
stretchStrategies: ❝Partner Body Draw & Swap❞ – Students draw their partner and write 2–3 descriptive sentences under it (e.g., “She’s got long legs. She’s got short arms.”). Then they swap and check if the description matches.

items: Hai con chó >> two dog [two dogs]. Not only the form, but the pronunciation is tough here, as it changes depending on the final sound of the noun [s,z,iz]
